description: The Department of Fisheries and Oceans seeks the provision of high-frequency omnidirectional hydrophones, including any additional requirements for bid or contract. The bid is a request for proposal open bidding and the bidding process is based on price competition.
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement
### Request for Proposal - High Frequency Omnidirectional Hydrophones

#### Tender Details

*   *Title*: F3757-230583 - High Frequency Omnidirectional Hydrophones - RFP
*   *Reference Number*: WS4339568549-Doc4339652680
*   *Solicitation Number*: WS4339568549
*   *Publication Date*: December 13, 2023
*   *Tender Closing Date*: January 3, 2024, 2:00 PM (EST)
*   *Target Audience*: Interested parties
*   *Contracting Entity*: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)

#### Tender Summary

The Canadian government is seeking proposals from qualified suppliers to provide High Frequency Omnidirectional Hydrophones. The selected contract will be awarded to the supplier who submits the best value proposal based on the lowest price.

#### Tender Requirements

*   The proposed Hydrophones must be able to operate in high frequency and omnidirectional modes.
*   The Hydrophones must meet the required specifications and standards.
*   The supplier must provide detailed documentation and support for the proposed Hydrophones.

#### Tender Contact Information

*   *Contact Person*: Simon Presse
*   *Contact Email*: [simon.presse@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:simon.presse@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
*   *Notice URL*: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18272827?extsite=MTgyNzI4MjdfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

#### Tender Classification

*   *UNSPSC Code*: 41111900
*   *Description*: Indicating and recording instruments

#### Trade Agreements

*   The Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) applies to this tender.
*   Suppliers must ensure they meet the requirements of the CFTA to participate in this tender.

Note: The tender announcement details are subject to change. Interested parties are encouraged to review the tender documents and contact the contracting entity for further information. 

---

Code changes are shown as inline comments, wherein I used the `autopep8` command in this code:
